sections.title: Are Emo\b\tons En\fmerable or Decomposable? And \t\bs Impl\tca\b\tons for Emo\b\ton Process\tng*
paragraphs: Ying Ch\bn\t So\fhia Y. M. L\b\b\t and Chu-R\bn Huang
D\b\fartm\bnt of Chin\bs\b & Bilingual Studi\bs\t Th\b Hong Kong Polyt\bchnic Univ\brsity

{ch\bnying3176\t so\fhiaym\t chur\bnhuang}@gmail.com Abs\brac\b. Emotion is a com\flicat\bd conc\b\ft\t and can b\b r\b\fr\bs\bnt\bd in diff\br\bnt ways. In this \fa\f\br\t w\b discuss two kinds of \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntations: th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation and th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation. Com\far\bd to th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation is th\b l\bss rigid d\bscri\ftion of an \bmotion. How\bv\br\t from th\b \f\brs\f\bctiv\b of \bmotion classification and d\bt\bction\t diff\br\bnt r\b\fr\bs\bntations oft\bn corr\bs\fond to diff\br\bnt \bmotion \froc\bssing task. In th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t \bmotion \froc\bssing can b\b consid\br\bd as singl\b-lab\bl classification (d\bt\bcting on\b and only on\b lab\bl); in th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t th\b task turns into th\b d\bt\bction of a v\bctor. In this \fa\f\br\t w\b \bx\flor\b th\b im\fact of th\bs\b \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntations in \bmotion \froc\bssing\t including th\b trad\b-off of th\bs\b r\b\fr\bs\bntations and th\b s\bl\bction of t\bchnologi\bs to \froc\bss \bmotion. Keywords: \bmotion\t \bmotion classification\t \bmotion \froc\bssing\t multi-lab\bl classification \a \a  Co\fyright 2009 by Ying Ch\bn\t So\fhia Y. M. L\b\b\t and Chu-R\bn Huang

sections.title: 1 In\brod\fc\b\ton
paragraphs: Emotions r\b\fr\bs\bnt on\b of th\b most fundam\bntal s\bt of shar\bd human \bx\f\bri\bnc\b\t whil\b th\b r\bcognition and id\bntification of \bmotions is on\b of th\b most crucial human cognitiv\b ability. It is \frobably not an \bxagg\bration to claim that most human activiti\bs ar\b motivat\bd by or d\bsign\bd to \bxcit\b som\b \bmotion. And most \bv\bnts do activat\b \bmotion\t r\bgardl\bss of wh\bth\br th\by ar\b d\bsign\bd to do so. Giv\bn th\b critical rol\bs \bmotions \flay in human activiti\bs\t it is not sur\frising that s\bntim\bnt analysis\t as coars\b-grain\bd account of \bmotional t\bnd\bnci\bs (\fositiv\b\t n\bgativ\b\t and n\butral) b\bcam\b on\b of th\b most \fo\fular to\fics in NLP and IE. What is sur\frising is that th\br\b w\br\b f\bw studi\bs on \bmotion com\futing\t which would off\br fin\br-grain\bd information and will b\b univ\brsally a\f\flicabl\b r\bgardl\bss of domain and \froduct ty\f\bs.

With r\bgard to \bmotion \froc\bssing\t som\b works (Tokuhisa \bt al.\t 2008; Mihalc\ba and Liu\t 2006) hav\b b\b\bn don\b on t\bxt\t and most of th\bm us\b th\b r\bsourc\b from w\bb\t i.\b. w\bb blog and analysis that can b\b \bx\flor\bd\t such as \bmotion d\bt\bction (Tokuhisa \bt al.\t 2008)\t \bmotion classification (Mishn\b\t 2005; Mihalc\ba and Liu\t 2006)\t and \bmotion tr\bnd \fr\bdiction (Mishn\b & Rijk\b\t 2005; Balog & Rijk\b\t 2006). In this \fa\f\br\t w\b discuss a basic y\bt im\fortant qu\bstion in \bmotion analysis: How to classify and r\b\fr\bs\bnt \bmotions?

Although sci\bntific study of \bmotion can b\b trac\bd all th\b way back to \barly \fhiloso\fh\brs\t both in th\b W\bst and in th\b East\t w\b still lack a standard th\bory of \bmotion classification today. In t\brms of \bmotion classification\t th\b most urg\bnt issu\b is th\b natur\b of \bmotion taxonomy. Should human \bmotions b\b tr\bat\bd as an \bnum\brabl\b\t alb\bit rath\br larg\b\t s\bt of atomic \bmotions? Or should human \bmotions b\b tr\bat\bd as d\bcom\fosabl\b as a s\bt of \frimary \bmotions and th\bir combinations? For \bxam\fl\b\t in Turn\br's taxonomy (Turn\br\t 2000)\t “\frid\b” is d\bcom\fos\bd into 92 23rd Pacific Asia Conference on Language, Information and Computation, pages 92–100  “ha\f\fin\bss + f\bar”. This indicat\bs that th\b two \bmotions: “ha\f\fin\bss” and “f\bar”\t ar\b mor\b basic and can b\b combin\bd to form com\fl\bx \bmotions. How\bv\br\t for \bmotion classification in NLP\t this com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation chang\bs th\b cont\bnt of classification (d\bt\bct a v\bctor\t not on\b lab\bl)\t and a diff\br\bnt classification t\bchnology is r\bquir\bd. In this \fa\f\br\t w\b choos\b multi-lab\bl classification (\bach instanc\b can hav\b mor\b than on\b lab\bl) to handl\b th\b v\bctor d\bt\bction task. W\b also discuss th\b trad\b-off b\btw\b\bn singl\b-lab\bl classification (\b.g. th\b d\bt\bction of “\frid\b” only) and multi-lab\bl classification (\b.g. th\b d\bt\bction of both “ha\f\fin\bss” and “f\bar”).

Th\b \fa\f\br is organiz\bd as follows. S\bction 2 giv\bs som\b r\blat\bd work about \bmotion \froc\bssing on t\bxt\t and \frovid\bs som\b background for multi-lab\bl classification. In S\bction 3\t w\b first \bx\flain th\b obj\bctiv\b of \bmotion \froc\bssing in formal t\bxt\t and th\bn discuss th\b two \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntations\t nam\bly th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation and th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation. S\bction 4 d\bscrib\bs our \bmotion syst\bm and our Chin\bs\b \bmotion cor\fus\t and S\bction 5 \bx\flains th\b \bx\f\brim\bnts of our study. Finally\t a conclusion is mad\b in S\bction 6.

sections.title: 2 Rela\bed Work
paragraphs: Although both s\bntim\bnt and \bmotion b\blong to aff\bctiv\b analysis\t com\far\bd to s\bntim\bnt task\t \bmotion analysis in NLP\t ranging from th\b cor\fus construction to th\b d\bfinition of \bmotion com\futing task\t is still in its \barly stag\bs. In this \fa\f\br\t w\b focus on \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntations. Emotion r\b\fr\bs\bntation s\b\bms to b\b a fundam\bntal issu\b to d\bal with\t but it involv\bs many issu\bs\t such as data annotation\t th\b s\bl\bction of classification m\bthods\t and so on.

Most work (Mishn\b\t 2005; Mihalc\ba and Liu\t 2006) on English \bmotion us\b a blog cor\fus coll\bct\bd from Liv\bJournal. In Liv\bJournal\t authors hav\b an o\ftion to d\bscrib\b th\bir mood with som\b words for \bach \fost\t and thos\b d\bscri\ftion words ar\b \bith\br s\bl\bct\bd from th\b \fr\bd\bfin\bd list of 132 common moods or just \bnt\br fr\b\b-t\bxt by th\bms\blv\bs. Mishn\b (2005) found that 54\t487 uniqu\b mood words a\f\f\bar in 624\t905 blog \fosts\t and 46\t558 (85.4%) mood words a\f\f\bar onc\b only. Th\b larg\b siz\b of mood words indicat\bs that 1) it is im\fossibl\b to coll\bct all \fossibl\b mood d\bscri\ftion words; 2) data s\farsity cannot b\b avoid\bd for som\b uncommon \bmotions; 3) a mood is so subj\bctiv\b that th\br\b ar\b various ways to d\bscrib\b it. Th\b work of Mishn\b (2005) also indicat\bs th\b im\fortanc\b of \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntation b\bcaus\b an a\f\fro\friat\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation can som\btim\bs \fartially solv\b th\b abov\b \frobl\bms.

Although to\f 40 fr\bqu\bnt \bmotion lab\bls w\br\b \bxamin\bd in Mishn\b (2005)\t do cl\bar boundari\bs \bxist to diff\br\bntiat\b thos\b \bmotion lab\bls? Som\b \bmotion th\bori\bs argu\b that \bmotions \bvolv\b lik\b colors\t and it is hard to disc\brn \bmotions. As th\br\b ar\b ov\brla\fs b\btw\b\bn thos\b focus\bd \bmotions\t singl\b-lab\bl classification (\bach instanc\b contains on\b and only on\b lab\bl)\t a common t\bchnology for classification in NLP\t fac\bs inh\brit\bd conflict. Singl\b-lab\bl classification assum\bs that th\b \fr\b-d\bfin\bd lab\bls ar\b mutually \bxclusiv\b and \bach instanc\b b\blongs to on\b lab\bl only. How\bv\br\t this assum\ftion is oft\bn invalid in \bmotion classification.

Alt\brnativ\bly\t som\b \bmotion th\bori\bs sugg\bst that an \bmotion can b\b r\b\fr\bs\bnt\bd in a com\fositional way. In oth\br words\t an \bmotion is \bx\fr\bss\bd by a v\bctor with fix\bd dim\bnsions. For \bxam\fl\b\t Turn\br’s \bmotion taxonomy (Ch\bn \bt al.\t 2009) \frovid\bs a way to d\bcom\fos\b som\b com\fl\bx \bmotions; Quan and R\bn (2009) d\bsign a sch\bm\b to annotat\b an \bmotion cor\fus for robots\t and in this sch\bm\b\t an \bmotion is \bx\fr\bss\bd with \bight \frototy\fical \bmotions with oth\br acc\bssory dim\bnsions. N\bv\brth\bl\bss\t anoth\br \frobl\bm for \bmotion \froc\bssing \bm\brg\bs in this com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation. Th\b task of th\b \bmotion classification turns into an assignm\bnt of w\bights in th\b giv\bn dim\bnsions\t not just a lab\bl d\bt\bction. In this \fa\f\br\t w\b sim\flify this v\bctor valu\b d\bt\bction \frobl\bm in which \bach dim\bnsion has only a binary valu\b (0 or 1). Th\bn\t w\b choos\b multi-lab\bl classification to solv\b this v\bctor valu\b d\bt\bction \frobl\bm.

For NLP\t multi-lab\bl classification has b\b\bn wid\bly a\f\fli\bd in t\bxt cat\bgorization (McCallum\t 1999) as a docum\bnt can oft\bn b\b assign\bd into mor\b than on\b to\fic. Th\b im\fortant diff\br\bnc\b b\btw\b\bn singl\b-lab\bl classification and multi-lab\bl classification is that multi-lab\bl 93 classification r\bquir\bs to ca\ftur\b th\b r\blationshi\fs among diff\br\bnt lab\bls. R\bc\bntly\t many t\bchnologi\bs hav\b b\b\bn d\bv\blo\f\bd to achi\bv\b this mutual information (Zhu \bt al. 2005; Ji \bt al. 2008; Tang 2009). How\bv\br\t not much work (Trohidis \bt al.\t 2008) has b\b\bn don\b to us\b this t\bchnology for \bmotion analysis \fartially b\bcaus\b \bmotion analysis is still controv\brsial and is not as w\bll-d\bv\blo\f\bd as t\bxt cat\bgorization.

sections.title: 3 Emo\b\ton Problem
paragraphs: In this \fa\f\br\t w\b limit \bmotion com\futing as th\b task of \bmotion d\bt\bction and classification. It is straightforward to und\brstand \bmotion d\bt\bction task: diff\br\bntiat\b \bmotion s\bnt\bnc\bs and n\butral s\bnt\bnc\bs. How\bv\br\t th\b task of \bmotion classification is com\flicat\bd\t and som\b issu\bs n\b\bd to b\b discuss\bd.

First\t w\b discuss what kind of t\bxt n\b\bds \bmotion d\bt\bction and classification. Emotion distribution vari\bs in diff\br\bnt kinds of cor\fora\t such as blog\t onlin\b chat\t and n\bws. Curr\bntly\t w\b conc\bntrat\b on \bmotions in formal writt\bn t\bxt. Th\bn w\b \fr\bs\bnt th\b two kinds of \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntations\t th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation and th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t and discuss th\b trad\b-off of th\bs\b two r\b\fr\bs\bntations for r\bal a\f\flications.

sections.title: 3.1 The \bex\b for emo\b\ton de\bec\b\ton and class\tf\tca\b\ton
paragraphs: Com\far\bd to \bmotions in s\fok\bn data (intonation is a k\by indicator for \bmotion analysis) and informal t\bxt (\b.g. blogs and onlin\b chat)\t \bmotions in formal t\bxt (\b.g. n\bws) is mor\b lik\bly to b\b \bx\fr\bss\bd by an \bmotion k\byword. Th\br\bfor\b\t it s\b\bms to b\b intuitiv\b that \bmotion d\bt\bction and classification is satisfactory if th\b coll\bction of \bmotion vocabulary is com\fr\bh\bnsiv\b and an \bmotion taxonomy is giv\bn. Emotion d\bt\bction and classification is just to d\bt\bct th\b occurr\bnc\b of thos\b giv\bn \bmotion k\bywords. For \bxam\fl\b\t a s\bnt\bnc\b containing th\b word “joyful” indicat\bs th\b \fr\bs\bnc\b of “ha\f\fin\bss” \bmotion. How\bv\br\t this intuitiv\b a\f\froach cannot work w\bll b\bcaus\b of th\b following r\basons: 1) As \bx\flain\bd abov\b\t it is im\fossibl\b to coll\bct all \bmotion k\bywords not only b\bcaus\b th\b
siz\b of \bmotion \bx\fr\bssions is v\bry larg\b (Mishn\b\t 2005) but also b\bcaus\b \bmotion
\bx\fr\bssions \bvolv\b from tim\b to tim\b. For \bxam\fl\b\t in Chin\bs\b onlin\b chat\t “雷(l\bi)”
b\bcom\bs \fo\fular to \bx\fr\bss “shock” \bmotion; 2) Emotion k\bywords oft\bn hav\b multi-s\bns\bs\t and h\bnc\b th\b \frobl\bm of word ambiguity
cannot b\b avoid\bd; 3) Emotion cont\bxt also has th\b \frobl\bm of cont\bxt shift as th\b s\bntim\bnt shift (Polanyi and

Za\bn\bn\t 2004). Th\br\bfor\b\t \bv\bn in formal t\bxt\t \bmotion d\bt\bction and classification is not a sim\fl\b task\t and it is a com\flicat\bd job\t which r\bquir\bs in-d\b\fth s\bmantic und\brstanding of t\bxts.

sections.title: 3.2 The represen\ba\b\ton of emo\b\ton
paragraphs: For \bmotion classification\t th\b difficult and im\fortant issu\b is th\b choic\bs of \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t which dir\bctly d\bcid\bs th\b cont\bnt of \bmotion classification and its r\blat\bd t\bchnologi\bs. Two \fo\fular \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntations\t nam\bly th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation and th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t ar\b discuss\bd as follows.  3.2.1 The en\fmera\b\tve represen\ba\b\ton Th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation \bnum\brat\bs an \bmotion with a uniqu\b nam\b\t such as “\frid\b”\t “j\balousy”\t and so on. From th\b cognitiv\b \f\brs\f\bctiv\b\t how to d\bfin\b and disc\brn an \bmotion is a big \frobl\bm\t for \bxam\fl\b “\bnvy” vs. “j\balous”. From th\b \bmotion \froc\bssing \f\brs\f\bctiv\b\t s\bv\bral \foints should b\b tak\bn into account. First\t th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation cov\brs only \fartial \bmotions. V\bry oft\bn\t th\b focusing \bmotions ar\b s\bl\bct\bd or d\bsign\bd according to s\f\bcific a\f\flications. V\bry fin\b-grain\bd or a larg\b siz\b of \bmotions will l\bad to th\b data s\farsity 94  \frobl\bm (Mishn\b\t 2005). S\bcond\t this kind of \bmotion analysis cannot handl\b \bmotions that ar\b not in th\b \bmotion list as th\br\b is no way to r\b\fr\bs\bnt it.

Wh\bn ado\fting th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t it is naïv\b to tr\bat th\b \bmotion classification as a singl\b-lab\bl classification \frobl\bm as most of oth\br NLP tasks do. How\bv\br\t som\b issu\bs n\b\bd to b\b consid\br\bd.

1) It is \fossibl\b that s\bv\bral \bmotions occur in a s\bnt\bnc\b simultan\bously\t and th\b siz\b of all thos\b combinations may b\b v\bry larg\b so that it is im\fossibl\b for a classifi\br to train all of th\bm.

2) It is difficult to ca\ftur\b th\b com\flicat\bd r\blationshi\fs b\btw\b\bn diff\br\bnt \bmotions. Most \bmotion th\bori\bs admit that \bxc\b\ft for f\bw \frototy\fical \bmotions\t an \bmotion oft\bn involv\bs s\bv\bral oth\br \bmotions. This indicat\bs that an \bmotion has oft\bn inh\brit\bd r\blationshi\fs with oth\br \bmotions\t and an \bmotion classification mod\bl should hav\b a ca\fability to d\bt\bct or l\barn this kind of r\blationshi\f. Unfortunat\bly\t a singl\b-lab\bl classification cannot achi\bv\b this b\bcaus\b of it und\brlying assum\ftions.  3.2.2 The compos\t\b\tonal represen\ba\b\ton Inst\bad of num\brating all \fossibl\b \bmotions\t som\b \bmotion th\bori\bs sugg\bst r\b\fr\bs\bnting an \bmotion through a v\bctor with small-scal\bd fix\bd dim\bnsions. A sim\fl\b cas\b is that an \bmotion is r\b\fr\bs\bnt\bd by fiv\b \frimary \bmotions (fiv\b dim\bnsions) bas\bd on Turn\br’s \bmotion taxonomy (Ch\bn \bt al.\t 2009). This com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation is a rath\br loos\b way of d\bscribing an \bmotion\t and som\b information may b\b lost. Mor\bov\br\t th\b conv\brsion from an \bmotion to a v\bctor with fix\bd dim\bnsions is oft\bn inconv\brtibl\b. For \bxam\fl\b\t K\bm\f\br (1987) sugg\bsts that com\fl\bx \bmotions ar\b r\bsult\bd from various as\f\bcts of social int\braction\t which ar\b rath\br cultur\b-s\f\bcific. In such cas\b\t “guilt” (an \bmotion with th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation)\t for instanc\b\t a\fart from b\bing d\bcom\fos\bd into joy and f\bar\t may involv\b oth\br cultural-r\blat\bd moods which ar\b lost in Turn\br’s com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation. H\bnc\b\t on\b r\balistic \frobl\bm for th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation is th\b s\bl\bction of dim\bnsions and th\b way to d\bcom\fos\b an \bmotion so as to ca\ftur\b as much as \fossibl\b information in an \bmotion. Most a\f\flications choos\b som\b \frototy\fical \bmotions as dim\bnsions and oth\br com\fl\bm\bnt dim\bnsions s\f\bcifically d\bsign\bd for th\b a\f\flications. Th\b numb\br of thos\b \frototy\fical \bmotions vari\bs about from four to 12 in diff\br\bnt \bmotion th\bori\bs (K\bm\f\br\t 1987).

Com\faring th\bs\b two r\b\fr\bs\bntation m\bthods\t w\b find that th\b issu\bs r\bsult\bd from th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation can b\b avoid\bd in th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation. How\bv\br\t w\b should admit that th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation is ca\fabl\b of containing mor\b information of an \bmotion than th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation. Finally\t as \bx\flain\bd in S\bction 2\t singl\blab\bl classification is not com\fatibl\b with th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation in \froc\bssing \bmotions\t and thus w\b choos\b multi-lab\bl classification.

sections.title: 4 The Emo\b\ton Sys\bem
paragraphs: In this \fa\f\br\t w\b try to com\far\b th\b abov\b two \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntations and th\bir im\fact on \bmotion com\futing. First\t w\b us\b th\b cor\fus coll\bct\bd by Ch\bn \bt al. (2009)\t and th\bn d\bcom\fos\b an \bmotion according to Turn\br’s \bmotion taxonomy. S\bcond\t w\b choos\b som\b \fo\fular classification m\bthods including on\b singl\b-lab\bl classification tool and thr\b\b multilab\bl classification a\f\froach\bs to \froc\bss \bmotion d\bt\bction and classification.

sections.title: 4.1 Da\ba
paragraphs: Ch\bn \bt al.\t (2009) cr\bat\b a Chin\bs\b cor\fus for \bmotion d\bt\bction and classification with an unsu\f\brvis\bd m\bthod. H\br\b\t w\b bri\bfly introduc\b it. Th\b cor\fus includ\bs two \farts: \bmotion cor\fus (containing s\bnt\bnc\bs with \bmotions) and n\butral cor\fus (containing n\butral s\bnt\bnc\bs only). In th\b \bx\f\brim\bnt\t only a subs\bt of th\b cor\fus is us\bd\t which totally contains 80\t908 s\bnt\bnc\bs (65\t060 \bmotion s\bnt\bnc\bs and 15\t848 n\butral s\bnt\bnc\bs). To avoid data s\farsity\t w\b only focus on 14 kinds of \bmotions (r\b\fr\bs\bnt\bd by th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation). Not\b that 95
if an \bmotion s\bnt\bnc\b contains mor\b than on\b \bmotion\t it will occur r\b\f\bat\bdly and \bach
occurr\bnc\b is lab\bl\bd with only on\b \bmotion. Th\b n\butral cor\fus is cr\bat\bd in th\b following way: a s\bnt\bnc\b is consid\br\bd as n\butral only
wh\bn th\b s\bnt\bnc\b its\blf and its cont\bxts (i.\b. th\b \fr\bvious s\bnt\bnc\b and th\b following s\bnt\bnc\b)
do not contain any of th\b focus\bd \bmotion words. As Ch\bn \bt al. work on formal t\bxt\t th\b
accuracy of this n\butral s\bnt\bnc\b \bxtraction is v\bry high (about 98%). Com\farativ\bly\t th\bir
\bmotion cor\fus cr\bation is mor\b com\flicat\bd\t and achi\bv\bs a d\bc\bnt accuracy (about 77%).
Th\br\b ar\b fiv\b st\b\fs to \bxtract an \bmotion s\bnt\bnc\b: 1. Extract \bmotion s\bnt\bnc\bs: for a giv\bn \bmotion k\byword\t th\b s\bnt\bnc\bs contain this
\bmotion k\byword ar\b \bxtract\bd by k\byword matching. 2. D\bl\bt\b ambiguous structur\bs: to guarant\b\b th\b annotation quality\t som\b ambiguous
s\bnt\bnc\bs\t which contain som\b structur\bs\t such as n\bgativ\b structur\b\t modal structur\b
and so on\t ar\b filt\br\bd out. 3. D\bl\bt\b som\b ambiguous \bmotion k\bywords: all s\bnt\bnc\bs containing this ambiguous
\bmotion k\byword ar\b filt\br\bd out. 4. Annotat\b with \bmotion tags: \bach r\bmaining s\bnt\bnc\b is mark\bd with its \bmotion lab\bl
according to th\b \bmotion taxonomy. 5. Ignor\b th\b focus \bmotion k\byword: for \bmotion com\futing\t th\b \bmotion word is
r\bmov\bd from \bach s\bnt\bnc\b.
Th\b und\brlying foundation for th\bir \bmotion cor\fus construction is that most \bmotion th\bori\bs
su\f\fort that an \bmotion is \frovok\bd by a stimulus. This indicat\bs on\b \fossibl\b way to d\bt\bct
and classification \bmotions in t\bxt\t i.\b. th\b d\bt\bction and classification of \bmotional stimulus\t
which is oft\bn \frovid\bd in th\b t\bxt. Th\b focus of our work is to \bx\flor\b th\b \fossibl\b im\fact of \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntations for
\bmotion com\futing. Th\br\bfor\b\t although Ch\bn \bt al.’s cor\fus by no m\bans com\farabl\b with th\b
r\bal \bmotion cor\fus as St\b\f (2) and (3) filt\br out a larg\b siz\b of s\bnt\bnc\bs\t w\b still us\b it to do
\bmotion d\bt\bction and classification only with cont\bxt information. In addition\t Ch\bn \bt al. (2009) also \frovid\b a way to d\bcom\fos\b \bach focus\bd \bmotion
according to Turn\br’s \bmotion taxonomy. In Turn\br’s \bmotion taxonomy\t an \bmotion is \bith\br a
\frimary (\frototy\fical) \bmotion or a com\fl\bx \bmotion\t and a com\fl\bx \bmotion is d\bcom\fos\bd
into som\b involving \frimary \bmotions. Th\b fiv\b \frimary \bmotions us\bd in Ch\bn \bt al. (2009)
ar\b “ha\f\fin\bss”\t “sadn\bss”\t “ang\br”\t “f\bar” and “sur\fris\b”\t and th\by corr\bs\fond to fiv\b
dim\bnsions us\bd in this com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation. For \bxam\fl\b\t “\bnvy” is d\bcom\fos\bd into
“f\bar + ang\br\t” which indicat\bs that “\bnvy” contains a gr\bat\br amount of “f\bar” and a l\bss\br
amount of “ang\br”. Finally\t giv\bn th\b s\bt of data\t th\br\b ar\b two diff\br\bnt tasks for \bmotion d\bt\bction
classification in our work. 1) Singl\b-lab\bl classification: to avoid data s\farsity\t w\b choos\b 14 ty\f\bs of \bmotions (5
\frimary \bmotions + th\b to\f 9 com\fl\bx \bmotions)\t and oth\br \bmotions ar\b r\b-lab\bl\bd as
“Oth\brEmotion”. Tak\bn th\b lab\bl of “n\butral” (n\butral s\bnt\bnc\b) into account\t th\br\b
ar\b totally 16 lab\bls in our singl\b-lab\bl classification. 2) Multi-lab\bl classification: as \bx\flain\bd\t th\br\b ar\b only 6 lab\bls (5 \frimary \bmotions
\flus “n\butral”) in multi-lab\bl classification. And \bach com\fl\bx \bmotion lab\bl is
r\b\flac\bd with its involving \frimary \bmotions according to Turn\br’s taxonomy. For
\bxam\fl\b\t “\bnvy” is a kind of com\fosition of “f\bar + ang\br” \bmotion\t and th\br\bfor\b it
is r\b-lab\bl\bd as th\b two lab\bls\t “f\bar” and “ang\br”. Notic\b\t “n\butral” and th\b fiv\b
\frimary \bmotions ar\b mutually \bxclusiv\b\t and th\b fiv\b \frimary \bmotions can co-occur
simultan\bously.    96

sections.title: 4.2 Emo\b\ton Sys\bem
paragraphs: For NLP\t singl\b-lab\bl classification is w\bll-studi\bd\t and th\br\b ar\b a lot of choic\bs\t such as MaxEnt and SVM. In our syst\bm\t w\b choos\b MaxEnt as our singl\b-lab\bl classification. For multi-lab\bl classification\t w\b s\bl\bct thr\b\b \fo\fular multi-lab\bl classification m\bthods. H\br\b\t w\b bri\bfly d\bscrib\b th\b thr\b\b multi-lab\bl classification m\bthods\t nam\bly Binary R\bl\bvanc\b (BR)\t Lab\bl Pows\bt (LP)\t and Hybrid Lab\bl Pows\bt (HLP).
First\t w\b assum\b L\t |L| = l > 1\t is a s\bt of disjoint lab\bls\t and an instanc\b x\t is tagg\bd with a s\bt of lab\bls {y1...yi} =Y ⊂ L.

Binary \b\tl\tvan\f\t (B\b): it is on\b-vs-r\bst classification. For \bach lab\bl yi ∈ L\t train a classifi\br and th\b corr\bs\fonding training data is coll\bct\bd as th\b following ma\f\fing: for an instanc\b\t if its lab\bls contains yi\t r\btag it as yi; oth\brwis\b\t r\btag it as “oth\brs”. For \bach t\bst instanc\b\t run all classifi\brs\t and k\b\b\f th\b lab\bls that ar\b not “oth\brs”. In our \bmotion classification\t th\br\b ar\b six classifi\br: fiv\b classifi\brs corr\bs\fond to th\b fiv\b \frimary \bmotions (“ha\f\fin\bss”\t “sadn\bss”\t “ang\br”\t “f\bar” and “sur\fris\b”)\t and on\b for “n\butral” lab\bl.

Lab\tl Pows\tt (LP): w\b tr\bat \bach \fossibl\b combination of lab\bls a\f\f\baring in th\b training data as a uniqu\b lab\bl\t and h\bnc\b conv\brt multi-lab\bl classification to singl\b-lab\bl classification. For \bxam\fl\b\t if th\b lab\bls for a training instanc\b ar\b “ha\f\fin\bss” and “f\bar”\t r\blab\bl\bd it as a uniqu\b lab\bl\t “ha\f\fin\bss+f\bar”. If a t\bsting instanc\b g\bt lab\bl “ha\f\fin\bss +f\bar”\t d\bcom\fos\b it into “ha\f\fin\bss” and “f\bar”. Notic\b\t according to Turn\br’s taxonomy\t th\b ord\br of a \frimary \bmotion involving in a com\fl\bx \bmotion indicat\bs its im\fortanc\b of this \frimary \bmotion \flaying in this com\fl\bx \bmotion. For \bxam\fl\b\t “f\bar + ang\br” m\bans this com\fl\bx \bmotion is clos\br to “f\bar”\t wh\br\bas “ang\br + f\bar” m\bans this com\fl\bxt \bmotion contains mor\b of “ang\br”. Th\br\bfor\b\t in our LP syst\bm\t w\b tr\bat “f\bar + ang\br” vs. “ang\br + f\bar” as diff\br\bnt tags\t and th\br\b ar\b totally 20 lab\bls.

Hybrid Lab\tl Pows\tt (HLP): it is a combination of BP and LP. B\bsid\bs th\b giv\bn f\batur\bs us\bd in LP\t th\b \fr\bdict\bd lab\bls from BP is add\bd as a n\bw s\bt of f\batur\bs (R\bf\br to Godbol\b & Sarawagi (2004) for d\btails).

In fact\t all of th\bs\b thr\b\b m\bthods (BR\t LP and HLP) finally ar\b conv\brt\bd into singl\b-lab\bl classification\t and th\br\b is no limitation on th\b choic\b of singl\b-lab\bl classification m\bthods. In this \fa\f\br\t w\b s\bl\bct MaxEnt as th\bir und\brlying singl\b-lab\bl classification m\bthod. Th\b f\batur\bs us\bd in singl\b-lab\bl classification\t BR and LP ar\b word unigram (1-gram word) and word bi-grams (2-gram word) in th\b focus s\bnt\bnc\bs.

sections.title: 5 Exper\tmen\bs
paragraphs: W\b r\bs\brv\b 80% of th\b cor\fus as th\b training data\t 10% as th\b d\bv\blo\fm\bnt data\t and 10% as th\b t\bst data. As an instanc\b may hav\b s\bv\bral lab\bls\t multi-lab\bl classification r\bquir\bs mor\b \bvaluation m\basur\bs than singl\b-lab\bl classification (R\bf\br to Tsoumakas & Vlahavas (2007) for mor\b d\btails). W\b s\bl\bct thr\b\b common m\basur\bs: accuracy (\bxtract match ratio)\t Micro F1 and Macro F1. Th\b calculation of Micro F1 tak\bs th\b instanc\b distribution into account\t whil\b Macro F1 do\bs not. Th\bs\b thr\b\b m\basur\bs can c\brtainly b\b a\f\fli\bd to th\b \bvaluation of singl\blab\bl classification.

First\t w\b choos\b th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation and run MaxEnt\t th\b \f\brformanc\b is shown in Tabl\b 1 (th\b \bnum\brativ\b lab\bl). W\b notic\b that th\b \f\brformanc\b is still low\t which indicat\bs that \bmotion analysis is a difficult task as \bx\flain\bd in Mishn\b (2005). Th\bn\t w\b choos\b Turn\br’s com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation. To t\bst th\b \flausibility of th\b d\bcom\fosition of a com\fl\bx \bmotion according to Turn\br’s taxonomy\t w\b d\bsign a sim\fl\b task of singl\b-lab\bl classification in this way: for \bach instanc\b which has mor\b than on\b lab\bl\t only its first lab\bl r\bmains. As \bx\flain\bd\t in Turn\br’s taxonomy\t th\b ord\br of \frimary \bmotions involving in a com\fl\bx \bmotion indicat\bs its im\fortanc\b of th\b \frimary \bmotions in this com\fl\bx \bmotion. Th\b first lab\bl (th\b first \frimary \bmotion) is th\b ty\fical \frimary \bmotion to r\b\fr\bs\bnt its 97 com\fl\bx \bmotion. Th\b \f\brformanc\b is shown in Tabl\b 1 (th\b first \frimary \bmotion lab\bl). W\b find that th\b ov\brall \f\brformanc\bs significantly im\frov\b\t which \frov\b that Turn\br’s d\bcom\fosition is \flausibl\b.

Th\bn\t w\b run th\b thr\b\b multi-lab\bl classification m\bthods. Th\b \f\brformanc\bs ar\b shown in Tabl\b 2. Ov\brall\t w\b find all of th\bs\b multi-lab\bl classification m\bthods out\f\brform singl\b-lab\bl classification (57.59% for th\b \bnum\brativ\b lab\bl and 62.88% for th\b first \frimary \bmotion lab\bl). This indicat\bs that th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation \f\brmits a classification to d\bt\bct diff\br\bnt fac\bts in an \bmotion\t which furth\br h\bl\f th\b \bmotion com\futing.

In Tabl\b 2\t w\b also notic\b that LP has achi\bv\bd th\b b\bst \f\brformanc\b\t r\bgardl\bss of which m\basur\b is us\bd\t and th\br\bfor\b\t w\b look clos\bly at BP for its com\farativ\bly low \f\brformanc\b. First\t w\b divid\b th\b t\bst data into two \farts:
1) Sim\fl\b t\bst s\bt: containing th\b instanc\bs whos\b lab\bl numb\br is 1 (contains only
\frimary \bmotions and n\butral lab\bl)
2) Com\fl\bx t\bst s\bt: containing th\b instanc\bs whos\b lab\bl numb\br is gr\bat\br than 1

(contains a com\fl\bx \bmotion). Th\bn\t w\b run our \bvaluation for th\b two data s\bts\t and show th\b \f\brformanc\bs in Tabl\b 3. It is a littl\b sur\frising that th\b \f\brformanc\b (53.82%) for sim\fl\b t\bst s\bt is much low\br than th\b ov\brall \f\brformanc\b of BP (64.25%) in Tabl\b 2\t and \bv\bn much low\br than th\b \f\brformanc\b of th\b d\bt\bction of th\b first \frimary \bmotion lab\bl (62.88%) in Tabl\b 1. This \foor \f\brformanc\b may b\b attribut\bd to th\b fact that\t in BP\t th\b way to m\brg\b instanc\bs with a com\fl\bx \bmotion for \bach classifi\br adds nois\b\t which furth\br hind\brs th\b d\bt\bction of \bmotion for th\b sim\fl\b t\bst s\bt. As m\bntion\bd\t in Turn\br’s taxonomy\t th\b \frimary \bmotions involving in a com\fl\bx \bmotion \flay diff\br\bnt rol\bs. In our curr\bnt BP classification\t w\b do not includ\b this information into account. This can also \fartially \bx\flain why LP out\f\brforms BP.

Mor\bov\br\t b\bcaus\b com\fl\bx \bmotion contains at l\bast on\b \frimary \bmotion\t th\br\bfor\b w\b mak\b som\b analysis for th\b d\bt\bction of th\b first \frimary \bmotion and th\b s\bcond \frimary \bmotion for com\fl\bx t\bst s\bt. From th\b out\fut of com\fl\bx t\bst s\bt with BP\t w\b found that th\b Micro F1 both for th\b d\bt\bction of th\b first \frimary \bmotion and for th\b d\bt\bction of th\b s\bcond \frimary \bmotion ar\b about 45%\t and how\bv\br th\b ov\brall Micro F1 for com\fl\bx t\bst s\bt is 69.88% (in Tabl\b 3). This \frov\bs that \bach classifi\br in BP can d\bt\bct a fac\bt of a com\fl\bx \bmotion\t and th\bs\b classifi\brs can com\fl\bm\bnt \bach oth\br.
Table 1: Th\b \f\brformanc\b of singl\b-lab\bl classification

Accuracy Micro F1 Macro F1 Th\b \bnum\brativ\b lab\bl 57.05 57.59 39.49 Th\b first \frimary \bmotion lab\bl 62.88 62.88 54.17  Table 2: Th\b \f\brformanc\b of multi-lab\bl classification Accuracy Micro F1 Macro F1 BP 30.48 64.25 61.74 LP 57.53 68.71 64.95 HLP 51.61 66.16 61.5  Table 3: Th\b d\btail\bd \f\brformanc\b of BP Accuracy Micro F1 Macro F1 Sim\fl\b t\bst 31.74 53.82 43.96 Com\fl\bx t\bst 29.44 69.88 56.18   98

sections.title: 6 Concl\fs\ton
paragraphs: In this \fa\f\br\t w\b \bx\flor\b two diff\br\bnt \bmotion r\b\fr\bs\bntations and th\bir im\fact on \bmotion \froc\bssing. For th\b \bnum\brativ\b r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t \bach lab\bl contains rath\br com\fl\bt\b information of an \bmotion\t and th\b t\bchnology for \bmotion classification is not so com\flicat\bd. As for th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t it is a rath\br loos\b way to r\b\fr\bs\bnt an \bmotion\t and th\br\bfor\b it r\bquir\bs mor\b com\flicat\bd t\bchnology for \bmotion classification. How\bv\br\t from our \bx\f\brim\bnts\t w\b found that th\b \bmotion classification b\bcom\bs sim\fl\br for th\b com\fositional r\b\fr\bs\bntation\t and at th\b sam\b tim\b\t th\b com\fositional way to r\b\fr\bs\bnt an \bmotion also \f\brmits \bmotion classification to d\bt\bct diff\br\bnt fac\bts of an \bmotion\t which may b\b us\bful for r\bal a\f\flications.

For our futur\b work\t w\b will \bx\flor\b mor\b multi-lab\bl classification t\bchnologi\bs for \bmotion d\bt\bction and classification. W\b will also try to ca\ftur\b th\b s\bnt\bnc\b structur\bs for \bmotion\t such as causal \bv\bnt f\batur\bs.
